cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles E of Tampico, Mexico and 600 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northeast later today and accelerate toward the north-central Gulf Coast, aiming for a landfall near the Florida Panhandle Friday evening

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch is only east of the Ochlockonee River, FL to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings run from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Ochlockonee River, FL and from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward across the Florida Big Bend and eventually the southeastern Atlantic coast
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: None (cyclone remains several hundred miles east of Brownsville)
weather_observation.expected_leaving_port_date: None (cyclone influence never reaches the port)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No listed station near Brownsville (all probabilities <3 %)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Brownsville, TX
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated light outer-band showers possible; heavy rainfall axis stays east of Texas
